result.execSummary:
The defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Full Huber.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, to be paid from bail, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
*Provide DNA Sample.

*NO contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*NO violent contact with minor children.
*NO contact with victim, unless approved by the court or agent. Except  for text, email of telephone. Defendant advised of injunction and to follow most restrictive orders.

*Batterers Intervention program.
*Parenting classes.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antowain Contrell Cheatham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense is requesting that the probation be transferred to Texas.  Agent does not object, neither does the court.
Defendant has to complete batterers treatment and pay the fee.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed Victim Impact Statement.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 DAYS time served, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 40 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with minor children.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent. EXCEPT for text, email of telephone. Defendant advised of injunction and to follow most restrictive orders.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, to be paid from bail, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called on the record to clarify No Contact order. Court clarified that the supervised contact is ordered for all children, and that defendant can have supervised contact in the hospital setting with the children. Defendant further advised to follow the most restrictive order regarding contact between criminal and civil case. Case remains scheduled for plea & sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request from defendant to modify No Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order modified to allow for third party contact with victim to allow for arranging time with children. Court further allowed for defendant to have supervised contact with the children. Supervised contact with the children can occur in the residence of the victim, WITH CONSENT OF THE VICTIM, if the victim is NOT present in the home during visit.

Defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Pretrial Conference. Defense counsel requested case be set for a Plea & Sentencing Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antowain Contrell Cheatham
Current: 2636 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 05-04-2015)
Prior: 2636 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kierra C.   AND/OR  her present and future children    AND/OR  their residence    AND/OR   their places of employment or school

No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Defendant Antowain Contrell Cheatham in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-085

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
